question.title: Prevent the software keyboard from appearing in Android
question.body:
I am developing an Android application in Java in Android Studio. My environment details are as follows:

minSdkVersion: 29
targetSdkVersion: 35
Device: Android device with physical keys
Use of custom EditTextStyle: Yes

The process of screen transition is implemented by clicking a button. I want to prevent the software keyboard from being displayed when the EditText gets focus after the screen transition. setShowSoftInputOnFocus(false) is set, but the keyboard is displayed at the first input immediately after the Enter key screen transition on the physical keyboard.

Note: The software keyboard is not displayed when the screen is transitioned by tapping the button on the screen.

After typing once, it hides normally. What we are looking for.

How do I make sure that the software keyboard is not displayed when the screen transitions and the first bit of input is made, even if the EditText has the focus. In particular, a way to achieve the same behavior when the screen transitions with the Enter key on the physical keyboard.

If possible, I need a systematic solution rather than hard-coding.
